entity1.name: Virtual Reality (VR)
entity1.description: A technology that simulates a realistic 3D environment, allowing users to interact with it in a seemingly real or physical way.

entity2.name: Education
entity2.description: The process of facilitating learning and the acquisition of knowledge, skills, values, beliefs, and habits.

entity3.name: virtual reality
entity3.description: A computer-generated simulation of a three-dimensional image or environment that can be interacted with in a seemingly real or physical way by a person using special electronic equipment, such as a helmet with a screen inside or gloves fitted with sensors.

entity4.name: educational settings
entity4.description: Places or contexts where learning and teaching activities take place, including schools, universities, and other educational institutions.

entity5.name: virtual reality
entity5.description: A computer-generated simulation of a three-dimensional image or environment that can be interacted with in a seemingly real or physical way by a person using special electronic equipment, such as a helmet with a screen inside or gloves fitted with sensors.

entity6.name: education
entity6.description: The process of facilitating learning, or the acquisition of knowledge, skills, values, beliefs, and habits. Educational methods include teaching, training, storytelling, discussion, and directed research.

entity7.name: VR
entity7.description: Virtual Reality, a technology that simulates real-world environments and scenarios for immersive experiences.

entity8.name: medical students
entity8.description: A group of individuals studying medicine.

entity9.name: surgical procedures
entity9.description: Operations or treatments performed by medical professionals to treat diseases, injuries, or deformities.

entity10.name: virtual operating room
entity10.description: A simulated environment used for training and practicing surgical procedures without real-world risks.

entity11.name: history students
entity11.description: A group of individuals studying history.

entity12.name: historical landmarks and events
entity12.description: Places or occurrences of significant historical importance that are often studied or visited for educational purposes.

entity13.name: immersive virtual tours
entity13.description: Simulated experiences that allow users to explore and interact with environments as if they were present in them, providing a sense of immersion.

entity14.name: Visual learners
entity14.description: A group of individuals who learn best through visual aids and information presented in a graphical format.

entity15.name: Kinesthetic learners
entity15.description: A group of individuals who learn best through physical activity, hands-on experiences, or movement.

entity16.name: VR
entity16.description: Virtual Reality technology that provides immersive and interactive digital environments for users to engage with.

entity17.name: students with disabilities or learning difficulties
entity17.description: A group of individuals who have physical or cognitive impairments that affect their ability to learn in traditional educational settings.

entity18.name: virtual reality technology
entity18.description: An advanced form of computer-generated simulation where a replica of an environment is created and experienced through sensory experiences, typically involving sight and sound.

entity19.name: virtual reality
entity19.description: A computer-generated simulation of a three-dimensional image or environment that can be interacted with in a seemingly real or physical way by a person using special electronic equipment, such as a helmet with a screen inside or gloves fitted with sensors.

entity22.name: students

entity29.name: Virtual reality experiences

entity30.name: virtual reality devices

entity31.name: young children and adolescents
entity31.description: A segment of the population consisting of individuals who are below the age of adulthood, typically ranging from infancy through teenage years.

entity32.name: motion sickness
entity32.description: A common condition that occurs when the brain receives conflicting messages from the inner ear, eyes, and other parts of the body.

entity33.name: eye strain
entity33.description: Discomfort or fatigue in the eyes usually caused by intense use of the eyes over an extended period of time.

entity34.name: disorientation
entity34.description: A state where a person is confused about their location, time, or identity, often due to sensory overload or other factors.

entity35.name: VR headsets
entity35.description: Head-mounted displays used for virtual reality experiences, providing immersive visual and auditory environments.

entity36.name: students
entity36.description: A collective term for individuals who are enrolled in educational institutions or learning programs.

entity37.name: Professional development programs

entity38.name: teachers
